item.title: Real Weddings – Susanne and Jeff
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Susanne and Jeff are avid hikers and backpackers, so it was only...

The post Real Weddings – Susanne and Jeff appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
The Couple: Susanne and Jeff
The Location: Canmore Alberta
The Date: September 2020

Susanne and Jeff are avid hikers and backpackers, so it was only suiting that their outdoor wedding was held in the rockies, in beautiful Canmore Alberta (just outside Calgary. Their wedding was so unique and so “them” and it incorporated eucalyptus all over – my fav kind of decor… smells amazing, and easy to do!

I chatted with Susanne and Jeff after the big day to find out how it all went, and I’m so happy they shared their gorgeous photos with me (and now all of you!)

Their wedding was supposed to include 150 guests but with covid restrictions they were only allowed to have 100 people for the ceremony and 44 people for the reception. It was a lot of last minute planning as they didn’t know what the restrictions would be as they changed biweekly. But thankfully it all worked out and their wedding was on September 26 2020.

I was curious about their wedding theme, when I asked about it… I learned that they hike all the time and have summitted 32 mountains (#majorgoals) including Mount Temple (which is the highest peak you can hike without any climbing gear in Alberta). They don’t just hike…. they also camp (they’re purists, tents – not trailers!) and they spend their vacations adventuring as well (in 2019 they did an epic 2 week roadtrip to explore all of Oregon, tenting the entire time).

I know you’re super curious where these beautiful photos were taken…. they’re from Rundle Forebay and Camp Chief Hector YMCA Camp… I def want to check those places out after seeing these photos.

Instead of their original honeymoon plan to New Zealand and Fiji they pivoted and instead went to Uculet and Tofino and learned to surf (SOOOOO cool!)
Now that you know this backstory… the whole wedding decor is right on theme! Thanks so much for reading along about this epic wilderness wedding, and thanks Susanne and Jeff for sharing all about it!

xoxo
Sarah

Their floral recipe:

Eucalyptus (feather) x 7 bunches
Eucalyptus (silver dollar) x 7 bunches)

Vendor Love:

Flowers @_youfloral
Photographer: Jenna Grey @im.jennagreyMakeup: Jenni @jennimakeupartist
Hair: Miranda Thomas @mslay_studio and @mslay.weddings
Dress: The Bridal Centre in Calgary and its a the style Morilee by Madeline Gardner

The post Real Weddings – Susanne and Jeff appeared first on You Floral.

item.title: Real Weddings – Jess & Danny
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Jess and Danny had a beautiful style backyard wedding at Country Camo in Lumby. If you’re a fan of boho (and peacock chairs), keep scrolling, this wedding was beautiful! Jess owns her own business (Freckled Foxx Creations) – side note, I love boss babes. She incorporated her cute rentals into the decor and put in […]

The post Real Weddings – Jess & Danny appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
Jess and Danny had a beautiful style backyard wedding at Country Camo in Lumby. If you’re a fan of boho (and peacock chairs), keep scrolling, this wedding was beautiful!

Jess owns her own business (Freckled Foxx Creations) – side note, I love boss babes. She incorporated her cute rentals into the decor and put in white carnations and eucalyptus in bud vases.

Little bud vases are perfect to add effortless decor to sign-in tables. For all of you guys thinking of wedding decor, take note! Eucalyptus and carnations are very cost effective, long lasting, smell great, and are an easy way to decorate!

Any wedding that includes peacock chairs is an automatic favorite of mine.

How cute it this?!? Pinterest worthy for sure.

Thanks for reading!

xoxo

Sarah

Vendor Love:

Venue: Camo Country Weddings 
Bouquet & Crown: Kaye Fleur
Wedding Top: Top is handmade by The Seamless Seamstress  – skirt is Chantel Lauren Designs
Decor: Freckled Foxx Creations
Photography:  Abigail Eveline (editor) & Danika Lee (shooter)
Eucalyptus and loose florals in bud vases: You Floral

The post Real Weddings – Jess & Danny appeared first on You Floral.

item.title: Real Weddings – Kayla and Steven
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Kayla and Steven were married in a beautiful field in Canmore on September 26… with the dramatic backdrop of the mountains and the fall colors out in full force, they hardly needed any decor to add to the beauty of their day. To immortalize their special day forever, Kayla saved some of the flowers from […]

The post Real Weddings – Kayla and Steven appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
Kayla and Steven were married in a beautiful field in Canmore on September 26… with the dramatic backdrop of the mountains and the fall colors out in full force, they hardly needed any decor to add to the beauty of their day.

To immortalize their special day forever, Kayla saved some of the flowers from her bouquet, preserved them with silica gel powder and put them in a shadowbox frame. She also dried some of the greenery and baby’s breath and have them in a vase on display in her house. Pro tip: Hanging your florals upside down will give you the best result!

Their “Recipe”:

If you’re wanting to know the “secret sauce” to Kayla and Steven’s wedding florals, I’ve got it all written down below! The quantities were enough to make a floral hairpiece, bridal bouquet, 5 centerpieces, boutonniere, and the wedding arch. After the wedding, the guests took home the centerpieces from their tables, such a lovely parting gift!

  • White astrantia x 1 bunch
  • Pink alstromeria x 1 bunch
  • White spray roses x 1 bunch
  • Salal x 1 bunch
  • Seeded eucalyptus x 1 bunch
  • Baby blue eucalyptus x 2 bunches
  • Babies Breath x 1 bunch
  • Pink roses x 1 bunch
  • Blush waxflower x 1 bunch
Keep scrolling to see the beautiful arrangements this couple made… and the WOW location their beautiful rocky mountain wedding was set in.
Thanks for reading!

xoxo
Sarah

Vendor Love:

Flowers: You Floral
Location: Quarry Lake Park, Canmore AB
Hair- Salon 1463 https://www.salon1463.com
Makeup- Beautiful Calgary Bride
https://m.beautifulcalgarybride.com/page/page/7857903.htm
Dress- Everthine Bridal consignment
https://www.everthineboutique.ca
Photographer- Lester Berezowski
https://www.canmorephotography.com
Officiant- Julie Ann Derer
http://www.weddingstobraggabout.ca

The post Real Weddings – Kayla and Steven appeared first on You Floral.

item.title: Real Weddings – Abbey & Andrew
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Abbey and Andrew had a beautiful lake side wedding in Lake Country (near Kelowna BC)… they choose eucalyptus garlands for the tables and made mason jar bouquets filled with carnations and babies breath. Mason jars make SUCH good table arrangements, easy to make, affordable, and your guests can take them home at the end of […]

The post Real Weddings – Abbey & Andrew appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
Abbey and Andrew had a beautiful lake side wedding in Lake Country (near Kelowna BC)… they choose eucalyptus garlands for the tables and made mason jar bouquets filled with carnations and babies breath. Mason jars make SUCH good table arrangements, easy to make, affordable, and your guests can take them home at the end of the day! If you’re looking for something easy and beautiful, take a look at their recipe and photos – you might want to recreate the vibe for yourself!

Their Recipe:

  • Eucalyptus (silver dollar) x 3 bunches
  • Eucalyptus (baby blue) x 4 bunches
  • Carnations (white) x 2 bunches
  • Babies breath x 8 bunches

Vendor Love:

Photographer: Taleah Swabey.
Location: Private residence in Lake Country, BC.

The post Real Weddings – Abbey & Andrew appeared first on You Floral.

item.title: Real Weddings – Tina & Adam
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Tina & Adam were planning a Halifax wedding, but due to covid...

The post Real Weddings – Tina & Adam appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
The Couple: Tina & Adam
The Date: October 2020
The Location: Calgary AB

Wedding Details:

Tina & Adam were planning a Halifax wedding, but due to covid, they decided to have a small ceremony in Calgary this year and have the reception in 2021. Tina was a DIY champion, doing pretty much everything herself (flowers, food, decor, dress, makeup, and hair). The only thing she didn’t do was the cake, cookies and donuts (take a peek below, these are mouth-watering). If you’re looking for inspo on doing a small gathering, keep scrolling – their house was the gathering place, and it’s just so cute – houseplants definitely make the best decor!

Their Recipe:

  • Plumosa Fern x 1 bunch
  • Scabiosa – White x 1 bunch
  • Freesia – White x 2 bunches
  • Lisianthus – White x 1 bunch
  • Eryngium x 2 bunches
  • Ranunculus – Peach x 1 bunch
  • Anemone – White x 1 bunch

Vendor Love:

Photographer: @kelseyveraphoto
Florals: You Floral

The post Real Weddings – Tina & Adam appeared first on You Floral.

item.title: Real Weddings – Erin & Paul
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Erin and Paul had a gorgeous and sophisticated wedding...

The post Real Weddings – Erin & Paul appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
The Couple: Erin & Paul
The Place: Quesnel, BC – Richbar Golf and Gardens
The Time: September 2020

Erin and Paul had a gorgeous and sophisticated wedding, they choose to go with greenery themed, in their own words… they were looking for simplicity! Their venue in Quesnel (interior BC) was chosen because it is a family-owned business that has been in their family for generations.
Owning the venue gave some perks (like being able to prep in advance) and the whole team chipped in to get everything tip top shape. Parents, brothers, uncles aunts, and friends all helped clean and clear out a greenhouse and Erin’s mom did the hanging arrangements and the arch arrangement which was really special to me.

Erin (always the optimist!) said that having a Covid wedding ended up being a blessing in disguise as she got to incorporate a lot of details that she secretly wanted but usually don’t happen with traditional weddings. I.e they got to eat family-style, the bridal party got to sit down during the ceremony, and both moms were witnesses.

I asked Erin how she felt the day went and she share: “The day was so intimate and in the end, was exactly what we wanted – we wouldn’t change a thing.”

I love hearing such great things from couples, thanks so much Erin and Paul for having You Floral part of your special day! To check out what a greenery themed wedding looks like… scroll on down!

xoxo
Sarah

Their Recipe:

  • Ruscus (italian) x 2 bunches
  • Podocarpus x 2 bunches
  • Eucalyptus (parvifolia) x 3 bunches
  • Eucalyptus (feather) x 4 bunches
  • Olive x 5 bunches

Vendor Love:

  • Dress: Bisou Bridal
  • Hair: Kayla Crofts
  • Venue: Richbar Golf and Gardens
  • Photographer: Wildflower Photo and Film
  • Videographer: Darrin Rigo Photography
  • Rentals/Day of Co-ordination: Special Occasion Services Quesnel
  • Catering: Petter Cat Water
  • Charcuterie Boards: Longtable Grocery
  • DJ: Pure Sound PG

The post Real Weddings – Erin & Paul appeared first on You Floral.

item.title: Real Weddings – Jennifer & Kelvin
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Jennifer and Kelvin had a super unique wedding in Victoria BC, I “sat down” with Jennifer to pick her brain on her special day, their day was so cool, you’re going to love the photos/learning all about it… keep scrolling xoxo Sarah Sarah: What was your vibe? Jennifer: Viking-Wicca with an elegant flare. We really […]

The post Real Weddings – Jennifer & Kelvin appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
Jennifer and Kelvin had a super unique wedding in Victoria BC, I “sat down” with Jennifer to pick her brain on her special day, their day was so cool, you’re going to love the photos/learning all about it… keep scrolling

xoxo
Sarah

Sarah: What was your vibe? Jennifer: Viking-Wicca with an elegant flare. We really allowed for natural elements like the characteristics of the rustic charm of the house we were getting married in, but also adding a lot of personal touches. We got married on Friday the 13th, which really encompasses who we are as horror fans and general “freaks”.

Sarah: Where was your ceremony? Jennifer: It was located at a private residence in Northen Sannich on a beautiful property. If it was warm out, we’d certainly like to make better use of the large property greenery. We did some ceremony photos at Island View Beach, filled with smoke bombs!

Sarah: Favourite part of the day? Jennifer: The first thing in the morning just making our coffees, sitting in the large dining room looking outside and just taking in the cool morning…relaxing.

Sarah: What colours did you choose? Jennifer: We chose to focus on a tone opposed to designate colours. We were looking to integrate texture with things like natural linens and lace, with a balance of things like copper (which stems from Kelvin having been a plumber for many years). We kept things neutral, but added burgundy and greens as our balanced colours. We loved the earthy palate! A romantic element was added with the blush pink in my dress, and in our flowers.

Sarah: What inspired your wedding decor? Jennifer: Getting started is always the hardest part! But after seeing some Halloween styled shoots, that helped firm things up a little. We had a hand-fastening ceremony, and ultimately that helped determine our “theme” because of what we used in the rope.

Sarah: Why did you choose You Floral? Jennifer: I really loved that You Floral had such a nice selection of natural and easy-going flowers available. I do not have a green thumb at all, but it was not difficult to find an assortment of flowers that I thought would suit nicely. I wanted lots of greenery, I LOVE eucalyptus so you know that’s gotta be in there, and the touches of soft pinks and white flowers gave it that romantic element. I loved the dark red berries incorporated that added that texture I love. SO happy with how it turned out. Sarah’s tutorials on making boutonnieres was extremely helpful and I had a lot of fun playing with the flowers to create all my small arrangements scattered across the house (in crystal skull vodka bottles LOL).

Their Floral Recipe:

  • Eucalyptus (baby blue) x 2 bunches
  • Silver queen pitt x 1 bunch
  • Lisianthus (white) x 1 bunch
  • Hypericum (red) x 1 bunch
  • Spray roses (light pink) x 1 bunch
  • Alstromeria (red) x 1 bunch

 

Vendor Love:

Charcuterie: The Board Girl @theboard_girl
Photography: @secretwatersphoto
Florals: You Floral @_youfloral
Officiant: Andria Lee Winters @andrileewinters
Cake: Beth Hutton Creations @bethhuttoncreations
Hair Styling: Lillian Herner @everystrandmatters

The post Real Weddings – Jennifer & Kelvin appeared first on You Floral.

item.title: Real Weddings – Mitch & Meghan
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Their Day Mitch and Meghan were married in a beautiful ceremony in Calgary, Alberta. Their photographer took some stunning photos of their flowers – their ‘jewel toned’ wedding was perfect with the carnations for the pop of burgundy, and the white panda anemone really put a ‘luxe’ spin on it. They used our Eucalyptus & […]

The post Real Weddings – Mitch & Meghan appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
Their Day

Mitch and Meghan were married in a beautiful ceremony in Calgary, Alberta. Their photographer took some stunning photos of their flowers – their ‘jewel toned’ wedding was perfect with the carnations for the pop of burgundy, and the white panda anemone really put a ‘luxe’ spin on it. They used our Eucalyptus & Lace package and then added on a few extras (carnations and anemone), to really add their own personalized flair…that’s the beauty of flowers, you get to be the artist! Their boutineers were DIY’ed as well, the green you see is the floral tape, it looks super cute just like that – or if you’re more of a ribbon person, you can always go that route too.

If you’re curious how their DIY arrangements turned out (spoiler alert… GORGEOUS), scroll on down!

Their Floral Recipe:

  • Anemone (white panda) x 2 bunches
  • Carnations (burgundy) x 1 bunch
  • Eucalyptus & Lace Package:
    • Mondial Roses x 1 bunch
    • White Lisianthus x 1 bunch
    • Spray Roses (white) x 2 bunches
    • Waxflower (white) x 1 bunch
    • Baby blue eucalyptus x 2 bunches
    • Seeded eucalyptus x 2 bunches
    • Silver dollar eucalyptus x 3 bunches
    • Parvifolia x 1 bunch

The post Real Weddings – Mitch & Meghan appeared first on You Floral.

item.title: Real Weddings – Tulsa & Jared
item.dc:creator: Sarah F.
item.description:
Tulsa and Jared both grew up within the western lifestyle...

The post Real Weddings – Tulsa & Jared appeared first on You Floral.
item.content:encoded:
The Couple: Jared & Tulsa
The Date: August 2020
The Location: Maple Creek Saskatchewan

Tulsa and Jared both grew up within the western lifestyle, meeting through mutual friends within the rodeo community. They initially had a large wedding planned and like many couples, they had to downsize. Tulsa, in her cheerful style told me that she felt the more intimate setting made their day extra special.

Considering their western background, its not surprising that their wedding day had a western boho chic vibe! The location was phenomenal, at Jared’s parents generational ranch located in the Cypress Hills, South West of Maple Creek, SK. You’ll want to scroll down and check it out – def Pinterest worthy!

The Floral Details:

The dried florals definitely suited their prairie wedding and added beautiful aesthetic to their day. Tulsa has an awesome support network – shout-outs below!

  • Her sister-in-law picked native weeds & grasses that made the perfect addition to the florals she ordered from us
  • Her sister brought the DIY bulk florals and greenery from Calgary (we don’t have a Maple Creek shipping option unfortunately!).
  • Her friends and family helped arrange the bouquets & boutineers the day before the wedding

Their Floral Recipe:

  • Carnations (peach) x 1 bunch
  • Bleached ruscus x 2 bunches
  • Bunny tails (natural) x 2 bunches
  • Eucalyptus (baby blue) x 3 bunches
  • Mini pampas (white) x 4 bunches
  • Pampas grass (south american) x 2 bunches
  • Roses (quicksand color) x 1 bunch

Vendor Love:

Photographer: @dbergerphotography
Florals: @_youfloral
Dress: @opportunitybridal
Cake: @theshopc
Makeup: @alaynasartistry
Brides boots @idyllwind by Miranda lambert
Jeans & Grooms Shirts: @wrangler
Skull: @anchorlinedesigns
Decor: Jodi’s Decor & Rentals – Medicine Hat

The post Real Weddings – Tulsa & Jared appeared first on You Floral.
